#!/bin/bash

# Function to show the download progress bar
progress_bar() {
    # Set the length of the progress bar
    local bar_length=50
    local progress=$1
    local done=$((progress * bar_length / 100))
    local remaining=$((bar_length - done))
    local progress_bar="["

    for ((i=0; i<done; i++)); do
        progress_bar="#"
    done
    for ((i=done; i<bar_length; i++)); do
        progress_bar=" ${progress_bar}."
    done
    progress_bar="$progress_bar]"

    printf "\r$progress_bar $progress%%"
}

mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

# Get release info and download links
LATEST_JSON=$(curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/kettingpowered/kettinglauncher/releases/latest")
RELEASES=$(curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/kettingpowered/kettinglauncher/releases")

# Check if TAG_VERSION is set or if "latest" is specified
if [ -z "${TAG_VERSION}" ] || [ "${TAG_VERSION}" == "latest" ]; then
    # Select the normal .jar file (exclude sources)
    DOWNLOAD_LINK=$(echo ${LATEST_JSON} | jq -r '.assets[] | select(.name | test(".*\\.jar$") and (test("-sources") | not)) | .browser_download_url')
else
    VERSION_CHECK=$(echo ${RELEASES} | jq -r --arg VERSION "${TAG_VERSION}" '.[] | select(.tag_name==$VERSION) | .tag_name')
    if [ "${TAG_VERSION}" == "${VERSION_CHECK}" ]; then
        # Select the normal .jar file (exclude sources)
        DOWNLOAD_LINK=$(echo ${RELEASES} | jq -r --arg VERSION "${TAG_VERSION}" '.[] | select(.tag_name==$VERSION) | .assets[] | select(.name | test(".*\\.jar$") and (test("-sources") | not)) | .browser_download_url')
    else
        # Default to latest release if version check fails
        DOWNLOAD_LINK=$(echo ${LATEST_JSON} | jq -r '.assets[] | select(.name | test(".*\\.jar$") and (test("-sources") | not)) | .browser_download_url')
    fi
fi

# Check if the download link is valid
if [ -n "${DOWNLOAD_LINK}" ]; then 
    if curl --output /dev/null --silent --head --fail ${DOWNLOAD_LINK}; then
        # Get the file size for the progress bar
        FILE_SIZE=$(curl -sI ${DOWNLOAD_LINK} | grep -i Content-Length | awk '{print $2}' | tr -d '\r')

        # Download the .jar file with progress bar
        echo "Downloading server.jar..."
        curl -sSL --progress-bar --output ${SERVER_JAR_FILE} ${DOWNLOAD_LINK} |
        while IFS= read -r line; do
            # Extract the download progress percentage
            PROGRESS=$(echo "$line" | grep -oP '\d+(?=%)')
            if [ -n "$PROGRESS" ]; then
                progress_bar "$PROGRESS"
            fi
        done
        echo -e "\nInstall Complete"
    else        
        exit 2
    fi
else
    exit 1
fi
